results.title: The Story of Christmas
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The familiar story, told this time with the glowing, cameo-like zinc cut-outs of film animator Evelyn Lambart. Here the traditional cast might have been clipped from a joyful medieval manuscript, but it is embellished by the artist’s own whimsy - heraldic trumpet sounds, luminescent light, and wildflowers in every scene telling their message of rebirth. Film without words. (Award: New York.)

results.title: The Water waster
results.brief_description: A humorous look at the very serious problem of water wastage that poses the question “Can a water waster really be cured?” Steve Blackburn (of Tim and Debbie fame) plays the part of an irresponsible water user who needs to be taught a lesson or two.

results.title: A Case of eggs
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin, Daisy Bellefeuille, John Smith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a fast-moving spoof centred around Bruno, the moonlighter who despairs over his striking hens; Dean Goodspeak who hires Frances and Rita, of the Sisters of Detective Agency, to investigate the erratic behaviour of scientist Dr Morrow, a mysterious stranger; and David, the academic drop-out who is nursing a broken heart on his boat. An intriguing mystery story with an “all’s well that ends well” finish. Cast includes Peter Haworth, Micki Mansel, Jo Kirkpatrick and Bill Reiter. Packaged for Teaching English as a Second Language.

results.title: The Panda's boutique
results.creator_credit: Louis Elman, Shen Zuwei, Zhou Keqin, British Broadcasting Corporation and Shanghai Meishu
results.brief_description: A delightful Chinese animation about a family of pandas who run a boutique. Complete chaos is caused, one morning, when customers in all different shapes and sizes arrive and request some oddly shaped items.

results.title: A place of power in French Polynesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This series looks at the Pacific islands, the traditions associated with them and issues that pose problems to them. Tahiti is looked at in this particular film. Through the eyes of Karim, a Polynesian dancer, we glimpse the effects of western world influences and the effects of French and Church influences on Polynesian society and customs.

results.title: New Caledonia: a land in search of itself
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Oliver Howes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
The issue of maintaining a balance between the traditional cultures and western world influences is central to this series that examines the different islands of the Pacific. This particular program looks at French New Caledonia and we see how the Kanaks are determined to maintain their Melanesian heritage regardless of politics and alien cultural influences. This documentary is really about the tension between the original Kanak inhabitants of this Pacific Island and the French colonialist settlers that were coming to a head in the early 1980s with a movement towards independence from France.

results.title: A Catalyst for development, K.T.T.C.
results.creator_credit: Kenneth McCready and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Kenya is vitally concerned with education. With the help of the Canadian International Development Agency, the government built the Kenya Technical Teachers’ College (K.T.T.C.), where it trains people to teach at every level of technical education. Once trained, these teachers go out to the numerous village polytechnics situated throughout Kenya and teach their skills. By teaching trade skills to villagers, local industries may be developed and technology will be introduced to the country.

results.title: British Columbia: mountains to the sea
results.brief_description: A picturesque film that explores the different wild environments of British Columbia. The film records the change of the seasons and the effects that the changes have on the many species of wildlife and their habitats.
